name: "The Dresden Files" - "Hair of the Dog" Trivia Quiz | Television | 10 Questions

Yes.

	Dresden can carry the skull around, making Bob mobile. In the opening scenes of this episode he took Bob to a crime scene and used him to figure out what the victim and killer looked like.

questions.text: The dead woman from the beginning of the episode was what type of being?
questions.explanation:
Werewolf.

	Her body was found with all of the teeth pulled and hair missing. It was the 8th such case across the country, spawning a federal investigation.

questions.text: Dresden was charged with murder by the FBI.
questions.explanation:
True.

	They found silver iodide in his apartment. The same silver iodide was found in the system of 8 women from Memphis to Chicago. All 8 women were werewolves.

questions.text: Dresden broke out of jail and no one realized it right away. How did he manage that?
questions.correct: Enchanted a stick to look like him until it was touched
options: Used a potion to make jailers forget about him
He shut down the power to the building, leaving it dark inside
He stuffed his bed with pillows
questions.explanation:
Enchanted a stick to look like him until it was touched.

	After breaking out of jail, Dresden returned to his house and found out that it had been ransacked by the FBI.

questions.text: Who was turning women into monsters?
questions.explanation:
FBI Agent.

	Agent Raskin was a werewolf and needed to turn 9 woman and have them murdered in order to remove her own curse. Raskin was turning the women and her partner Agent Bushnell was killing them for her. The two framed Dresden for the murders.

No.

	She was the planned 9th victim for the FBI agents. She escaped from Agent Bushnell in the woods and ran to Dresden for help. Dresden instead made her an elixir that helped suppress the effects of the Lycanthropy.

questions.text: What was the name of the park where one of the murders took place?
questions.explanation:
Jefferson Park.

	Signs in the park definitely identified it as Jefferson Park, however in a goof in editing, there was a graphic that showed it as Jackson Park in one scene. The park is where Dresden took Bob early in the episode.

Agent Bushnell.

	Raskin accidentally bit him and then killed him, removing her own curse. He told her to do so. She ended up in the mental hospital after the ordeal.

questions.text: Why did Heather leave near the end of the episode?
questions.correct: She had to prove to herself she could resist temptation.
options: A hitman was looking for her.
She was wanted by the police.
She didn't explain why, just left town.
questions.explanation:
She had to prove to herself she could resist temptation.

	She wasn't cured completely of being a werewolf. She wanted to prove that Dresden's elixir would work, though she also didn't want to be near people in case it didn't.

questions.text: Why didn't the FBI discover Dresden's lab during the search?
questions.correct: It was behind a hidden wall.
options: They were under a spell and couldn't see anyt0hing magical.
It was behind a hidden wall.
They only searched the front room.
questions.explanation:
It was behind a hidden wall.

	Bob was in the lab and told Dresden all about the search when he got back. Nothing had been bothered in the search, as the FBI didn't bother checking to see if there was a false wall.
